title: 6 Easy Ways to Use Shortcut Keys to Shut Down a Windows PC

steps.title: Press Alt+F4 on your desktop.
steps.content: Press Alt + F4 on your desktop. If you aren't on your desktop, you can use Alt + F4 to close any active windows in your path. [1] X Research source A dialogue box will open. You'll see: What do you want the computer to do? In newer versions of Windows, pressing Alt + F4 for the first time may open the dialogue box first.

steps.title: Click Shut down.
steps.content: Click Shut down . You'll need to click the drop-down menu to find the option if it isn't selected already. [2] X Research source If you don't have access to the mouse, use the up and down arrow keys on your keyboard to cycle through the options until you reach Shut down .

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will immediately shut down your computer or laptop. To do this without a mouse, press Tab on your keyboard to switch the selection to the OK button. Press Enter to confirm.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+Alt+Del.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + Alt + Del . This keyboard shortcut will work regardless of what programs you have open. This will open a new screen with options to lock, switch user, sign out, change a password, open the Task Manager, and more. This method will shut down your computer or laptop without safely closing programs. This could cause corrupted files, so be sure to turn off your PC correctly if you can.

steps.title: Click the Power button in the bottom-right corner.
steps.content: Click the Power button in the bottom-right corner. This will open a pop-up menu. If you don't have a mouse, press Tab until the Power button is highlighted, then press Enter .

steps.title: Click Shut down.
steps.content: Click Shut down . This will immediately shut down your computer. You may receive a warning about closing unsaved programs. Click OK to proceed. If you don't have a mouse, press Tab until Shut down is highlighted, then press Enter .

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+X.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + X . This will open a menu on the left side of your screen. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Shut down or sign out.
steps.content: Click Shut down or sign out . This will expand the section. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You can also press U on your keyboard to expand the section.

steps.title: Click Shut down.
steps.content: Click Shut down . Your computer or laptop will shut down immediately. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you don't have a mouse, you can press U again to shut down your device.

steps.title: Press the Windows key .
steps.content: Press the Windows key . You can also click the Start menu in the bottom-left corner. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the Power button.
steps.content: Click the Power button. This will open a pop-up menu. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you don't have a mouse, press Tab , then use the down arrow to select the Power button. Press Enter .

steps.title: Click Shut down.
steps.content: Click Shut down . Your computer or laptop will shut down immediately. [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you don't have a mouse, press the down arrow to select Shut down , then press Enter .

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button. Do this until the screen turns black and you can no longer hear your fans spinning. Use this method if your computer or laptop is frozen and you're unable to use the screen or keyboard shortcuts.

steps.title: Right-click your desktop.
steps.content: Right-click your desktop. A pop-up menu will open. Use this method if you want to create a shortcut icon to shut down your computer or laptop.

steps.title: Hover over "New", then click Shortcut.
steps.content: Hover over "New", then click Shortcut . This will open a new window. [9] X Research source

steps.title: In the location field, enter the shutdown code.
steps.content: In the location field, enter the shutdown code. Copy and paste the following code into the location field: [10] X Research source %windir%\System32\shutdown.exe /s /t 0

steps.title: Enter a name for the shortcut.
steps.content: Enter a name for the shortcut. This can be something simple, such as Shut down .

steps.title: Click Finish.
steps.content: Click Finish . Your shut down shortcut will be created.

steps.title: Right-click the shortcut and click Properties.
steps.content: Right-click the shortcut and click Properties . This will open the Properties window. If you aren't already on the Shortcut tab, click it to navigate there now.

steps.title: Enter a Shortcut key.
steps.content: Enter a Shortcut key. By default, you'll see None assigned to the Shortcut key field. To change the key, click the Shortcut key field. The shortcut will be CTRL + ALT + a key of your choice. On your keyboard, press the key you want to use as the shortcut. This can't be a key that requires you to press and hold "Shift" to enter. Use a letter from A-Z or number from 0-9. If you want to change the shortcut icon, click Change Icon… .

steps.title: Click Apply, then OK.
steps.content: Click Apply , then OK . You can find this at the bottom-right corner of the window. This will save your changes.

steps.title: Use the Shortcut key to shut down your computer.
steps.content: Use the Shortcut key to shut down your computer. For example, if you used the letter K , the shortcut would be be CTRL + ALT + K . Your computer will shut down. You can also use Notepad or the Command Prompt to turn off your PC. If you have Remote Registry Service enabled, you could even shut it down remotely .
